page.title: 18WOOTTON GENERAL STORES
page.content: The owners of Wootton General Stores have run it for twelve months.The shop is between 60 and 70 years old,though it has not always been a grocery shop. It first opened as a newspaper shed on the other side of the road, but the owner, a Mr.Conway, bought the shop on the other side of the road.At the time it was a house, but it was later converted into a general store. They are kept in business all year round by regular customers.In the summer it is slightly busier because of passing trade from the Sealink Car Ferry. The shop is open from 6a.m. to 9p.m. except Sunday when it is open from 9a.m till 1p.m. The shop sells a wide range of foodstuffs, including fresh fruit and vegetables, newspapers, tobacco, alcoholic beverages, etc.
